materials.raw_text:
Chromium Oxide (Cr2O3) - 160 g 
 Zirconium Oxide (ZrO2) - 80 g 
 Binder (e.g., epoxy resin) - 50 g 
 Catalyst (if using epoxy) - 5 g 
 Filler (if needed) - 10 g

sourcing.instructions:
Chromium Oxide can be sourced from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. 
 Zirconium Oxide is available from industrial suppliers or specialty chemical stores. 
 Epoxy resin and catalyst can be found at hardware stores or craft suppliers. 
 Fillers can be sourced from construction material suppliers or specialty chemical suppliers.

3. In a separate container, measure 50 g of epoxy resin and 5 g of catalyst (if applicable) and mix well.
4. Gradually add the mixed oxides to the epoxy mixture while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. If using filler, add 10 g at this stage and mix thoroughly.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh out 160 g of Chromium Oxide and 80 g of Zirconium Oxide using a precision scale. 
 2. Combine the two oxides in a mixing bowl and stir to achieve a uniform blend. 
 3. In a separate container, measure 50 g of epoxy resin and 5 g of catalyst (if applicable) and mix well. 
 4. Gradually add the mixed oxides to the epoxy mixture while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. If using filler, add 10 g at this stage and mix thoroughly.

cooling.raw_text:
1. After curing, turn off the oven and allow the mold to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours) before removing it from the oven. 
 2. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the mold carefully to avoid breakage.
